business.headline: Wall Street bounces back after wild week fueled by tariff warAll three major US indexes ended the session sharply higher after assurances from Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins that the Fed is prepared to keep financial markets functioning should the need arise.

India pushing for trade deals with US, EU with high urgency: JaishankarOn Wednesday, Trump announced a 90-day pause on his sweeping tariffs on all countries, except China as countries around the world wilted under the impact of the seismic action.

How Trump tariffs could make iPhones, cars, and clothes costlier in the USTrump's latest plan includes a massive 145% tax on goods coming from China. Experts say this could end the long run of cheap, imported goods that Americans have enjoyed for decades.
Sensex ends 1,300 points higher, Nifty above 22,500; Tata Steel up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,310.11 points to close at 75,157.26, while the NSE Nifty50 added 429.40 points to end at 22,828.55.

Mutual fund SIP vs PPF: What Rs 1 lakh a year can earn in 15 yearsPPF is a government scheme with a current interest rate of around 7.1% per annum. On the other hand, SIPs typically offer higher interest when invested over the long term, especially in equity mutual funds. But they carry some risk, as returns depend on the market.

Explained: Why Muthoot Finance shares fell over 8% todayMuthoot Finance stock price: Muthoot Finance, one of India's largest gold loan companies, has seen its share price decline by 14% in the past five trading sessions. The stock is also down 7% over the past month.

Mutual fund inflows hit in March. Trump tariffs to blame?The largest outflows were seen in debt mutual funds, where investors pulled out Rs 2.02 lakh crore, possibly due to end-of-year financial needs by institutions and ongoing global uncertainty.

Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath's money advice: 'No shortcuts to getting rich'Nithin Kamath shared a video with a powerful message—earning more doesn't mean you're saving more. In fact, higher income often leads to more spending on gadgets, clothes, dining out, or things meant just to impress others.

Trump tariffs, trade war fears could bring your loan EMIs down further this yearBorrowers could emerge as the unexpected winners if global headwinds linger and domestic growth slows further, with the RBI likely to step in again to lower the key interest rates.

Wall Street crashes, Dalal Street rallies: 5 things investors should knowStock market today: Dalal Street's leading indices rallied sharply, defying a global sell-off sparked by Wall Street's overnight crash. Here are the key factors behind today's stock market rally.

Mutual fund inflows fall for March by Rs 4,221 crore, shows AMFI dataEquity mutual fund inflows dropped by Rs 4,221 crore in March, falling to Rs 25,082 crore from Rs 29,303 crore in February 2025, as per data released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

TCS shares fall after disappointing Q4. Check latest price targetsTCS share price: Despite a muted Q4, brokerages back TCS with revised targets, betting on deal wins, margin levers, and recovery prospects to drive medium-term gains.

entertainment.headline: How Marvel TV brought the MCU back to life after Endgame's uncertain futureAfter 'Avengers: Endgame', Marvel fans were uncertain about the future. However, shows like 'Agatha All Along' and 'Daredevil: Born Again' have reignited excitement and faith in the MCU.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 2: Ajith's film dips, eyes big numbers over weekendAjith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly' saw a drop in numbers on Day 2. However, trade experts suggest that the film will make the most of the extended weekend due to Tamil New Year holiday on April 14.

Apoorva Mukhija posts smiling pic with cryptic caption after public apologyInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija shared a smiling photo of herself with a cryptic caption on Friday. A couple of days ago, she publicly apologised for her comments and talked about the rape and death threats she received amid India's Got Latent controversy.

Gaurav Khanna wins Celebrity MasterChef, Nikki Tamboli, Tejasswi Prakash runner-upsActor Gaurav Khanna lifted the 'Celebrity MasterChef' trophy. Nikki Tamboli and Tejasswi Prakash bagged first and second runner-up spots, respectively.
Prakash Raj shares pic with Kunal Kamra, asks 'how to reach Tamil Nadu'Veteran actor Prakash Raj met comedian Kunal Kamra. However, it was the actor's caption that caught the attention of all.

Hrithik Roshan meets Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas in USHrithik Roshan recently revealed that he met Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas in the US. Their meet-up comes amid rumours of Chopra's casting reports in Krrish 4.

Exclusive: Banijay exits Khatron Ke Khiladi, future of new season uncertainKhatron Ke Khiladi 15's future looks uncertain as producer Banijay exited the show. This latest development has upset director Rohit Shetty.

Puratawn review: Sharmila Tagore's comeback film flows like a poemReleased-Fri Apr 11, 2025Puratawn review: Sharmila Tagore's comeback Bengali film explores the intertwining of past and present memories in an octogenarian's life. It also focusses on an intricate mother-daughter relationship. Read the full review here.
Actor Chahatt Khanna shares disturbing childhood memory of being molestedActor Chahatt Khanna recently shared a disturbing childhood memory of being molested by an elderly neighbour.

Agnyathavasi review: Slow and steady thriller about dark choicesReleased-Fri Apr 11, 2025Agnyathavasi film review: Produced by Hemanth Rao, this Kannada thriller is an interesting ride with its engaging story and technical brilliance. It has been directed by Janardhan Chikkanna and features Rangayana Raghu in the lead.

Singer Kumar Shanu's daughter Shannon K to perform at Coachella 2025Singer Kumar Shanu's daughter Shannon K is set to make her Coachella 2025 debut. The singer will be the first indie Indian-origin singer to perform at the global event.

From K-idol to screen icon, a spotlight on IU's illustrious careerKorean icon IU is both an accomplished actor and a K-pop star. The artiste is currently seen in Netflix's When Life Gives You Tangerines.

Viral: Superstar Rajinikanth arrives in Kerala for Jailer 2 shootSuperstar Rajinikanth arrived in Kerala's Attappadi to take part in the shooting of 'Jailer 2'. Directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, the current shooting schedule is expected to go on for about 20 days.

Priyanka Chopra reunites with Hrithik Roshan for Krrish 4: ReportPriyanka Chopra is reportedly believed to have joined forces with Hrithik Roshan again for Krrish 4. The next part of the franchise will be directed by Hrithik.

Nushrratt Bharuccha meets PM Modi, thanks him for rescuing her from IsraelNushrratt Bharuccha shared a post and thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for bringing her back from war-torn Israel during the recent conflicts. This comes after the actor met PM Modi at a recent event.

I'm just an actor: Akshay Kumar reacts to political row over Sankaran NairAkshay Kumar distanced himself from political comments linked to his upcoming film 'Kesari 2' in which he portarys a pre-Independence president of the Indian National Congress.

Akshay Kumar reacts to Jaya Bachchan's criticism of Toilet: Ek Prem KathaAkshay Kumar addressed Jaya Bachchan's criticism of his film 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' during 'Kesari 2' trailer launch, stating that if she believes the title is inappropriate, she must be right.

Empuraan box office: Mohanlal, Prithviraj's film storms past Rs 100 crore in IndiaMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan zoomed past Rs 100 crore at the domestic box office. On Day 15, the film witnessed a decline, earning only Rs 0.70 crore.

Sushmita Sen's sister-in-law Charu leaves Mumbai, is now selling clothes onlineSushmita Sen's ex sister-in-law, Charu Asopa, leaves Mumbai after facing a financial crisis. The actor even sold off her clothes online for extra money.

general news.headline: Army officer injured in gunfight with Pakistani infiltrators in J&K diesThe gunfight erupted after the Indian Army intercepted a group of terrorists attempting to infiltrate from across the border in the Keri Battal area.

No deal at gunpoint, India First approach: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USMinister Piyush Goyal emphasised that India and the US are progressing on a bilateral trade agreement, aiming to double trade to USD 500 billion by 2030.

Vanishing Daughters, Part 3: Being a decoy in a Beti Bachao Beti Padhao raidA journalist-turned-decoy narrates harrowing sting operation exposing India's illegal sex determination industry, where doctors moonlight as law enforcers, informers risk everything, and bureaucratic turf wars often let the culprits slip through the cracks.

Meta worked 'hand in glove' with China on censorship, betrayed US: WhistleblowerMeta whistleblower Sarah Wynn-Williams testified before the Senate judiciary subcommittee that the tech titan helped the Chinese government build censorship tools and also allowed it access to user data.

If Netflix's Adolescence was made in India, would the plot take a darker turn?Adolescence left many contemplating several things - upbringing, peer influence, the challenges of being a teenager in the social media era. But for me, the biggest question was this: if a series like this were made in India, would the narrative have been any different?

US court allows Columbia pro-Gaza activist Mahmoud Khalil's deportationMahmoud Khalil, a legal US resident, was taken into custody and flown to an immigration detention facility in Jena, Louisiana, far from his legal team and his wife.

MS Dhoni out or not out vs KKR? Virender Sehwag's brutal take goes viralFormer cricketer Virender Sehwag has taken yet another sharp dig at MS Dhoni after the team's heavy defeat against KKR on Friday. Sehwag said even if Dhoni had been not out, it would not have made any difference to the result of the game.

I don't respond to idiots: Devendra Fadnavis on RSS's role in 26/11 attacks remarkIn December 2010, Digvijaya Singh sparked a major controversy by claiming that Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) chief Hemant Karkare had spoken to him just hours before the 26/11 attacks began.

Rain, dust storm batter Delhi; trees uprooted, flights hit, more showers likely The abrupt weather change brought relief from the scorching heat but also caused extensive damage and chaos in several areas. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light rain accompanied by thunderstorms and squally winds for today.

Video: People jump from balcony, child dangles in air after fire at high-riseIn a viral video, the woman can be seen dangling one child in the air from the fourth floor, which was already engulfed in thick smoke. As the woman cried for help, a few people gathered on the third floor caught hold of the child, who was hanging mid-air.

FIR against three in Punjab after India Today expose on sex determination racketPunjab Police registered an FIR against three individuals after an operation, in which India Today played a key role, caught them running an illegal sex determination facility.

Annamalai likely to get national role in BJP, signals Amit ShahUnion Home Minister Amit Shah hinted at a national-level role for outgoing Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai, following his withdrawal from the race for the party's state unit president.

Watch: Smoke fills sky as plane crashes near Florida highway, killing 3 on boardA Cessna 310 crashed near Florida's I-95 shortly after takeoff, killing all three aboard and severely injuring a motorist. The fiery crash triggered panic, damaged a car, and caused road and rail closures.

Who was Sir C Sankaran Nair, the 'forgotten patriot' played by Akshay Kumar?Sir C Sankaran Nair, a civil rights advocate from the time of Indian freedom movement, will be played by Akshay Kumar on the big screen. Sankaran Nair was not just a fiery nationalist and civil rights advocate, he was also a former Indian National Congress president who was a forgotten hero, up until now.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Trump's stern warning to Iran: All hell to pay if nuclear programme continuesSpeaking to reporters, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt emphasised that President Donald Trump's top priority is preventing Iran from ever acquiring a nuclear weapon.

India's first extradition battle: When a daughter forgave her father's killerIndia's first extradition battle to get custody of Khalistani separatist Ranjit Singh 'Kuki' Gill lasted 12 years. Gill was among the three who killed Congress MP Lalit Maken, his wife and bodyguard in Delhi in 1985. Gill, extradited in 2000, walked free in 2009, after their daughter, Avantika Maken, forgave him for the murders.

Hyundai Santro: The car that challenged Maruti's supremacyIn the late 1990s, India's car market was dominated by Maruti Suzuki, but Hyundai's Santro disrupted the scene with its tall-boy design, practicality, and Shah Rukh Khan's endorsement, redefining small-car expectations.

Big step towards justice: Jaishankar on 26/11 plotter Tahawwur Rana's extraditionS Jaishankar lauded the extradition of 26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana, calling it a major step toward justice. Rana was extradited to India form the US on a special flight on Thursday evening

Man caught filming woman bathing in Ayodhya; obscene videos found on phonePolice examined the accused's mobile phone and recovered ten videos of women bathing, along with several obscene photos and videos. The matter is under investigation and the police are currently interrogating the accused.
Waqf protest turns violent in Bengal, mob throws stones at train, cops injuredAt least two trains have been cancelled, and another five have been diverted in the wake of the incident.

sports.headline: CSK not ready to surrender yet: Defiant Hussey hopeful of playoffs spotIPL 2025: CSK batting coach Mike Hussey said that the team is not ready to surrender just yet. CSK fell to a heavy defeat against KKR on Friday, April 11, losing their 5th game in a row.

Wake up CSK! T20 cricket is evolving and it's leaving you behindCSK's reluctance to move from their mantra of banking on experienced stars have massively backfired, leaving the five-time champions in one of their worst phases in IPL history. With T20 cricket evolving, Chennai are under the threat of being left behind the rest.

Pretending to be a cricket team: CSK memes viral after humiliating KKR lossFans decided to have some fun at the expense of the Chennai Super Kings as memes went viral on social media after their humbling loss to Kolkata Knight Riders at the Chepauk on Friday, April 11.

MS Dhoni reacts to CSK's horror defeat to KKR, defends powerplay styleIPL 2025, CSK vs KKR: MS Dhoni defended CSK's style in the powerplay, but urged the batters to be more responsible and build partnerships. CSK did not hit a single six in the powerplay on Friday and managed just 31 runs in the first six overs.

CSK's worst on MS Dhoni's return to captaincy: Stat PackIPL 2025, CSK vs KKR: Chennai Super Kings had a rough time on Friday after Kolkata Knight Riders handed them an eight-wicket defeat at the MA Chidambaram Stadium. The Super Kings also made some embarrassing records following their huge loss.

CSK vs KKR: No captain Mahi magic as Chennai slip to new low at homeIPL 2025, CSK vs KKR: MS Dhoni's return to captaincy did not go according to plan as the Super Kings suffered one of their biggest defeats in IPL history. KKR chased down 104 in just 10.1 overs, handing CSK their third successive defeat at home.

Never seen Sai Kishore bowl this well: Shahrukh Khan heaps praise on GT spinnerShahrukh Khan heaped praise on GT spinner Sai Kishore and claimed that he had never seen his Tamil Nadu teammate bowl so well. Kishore has been one of the key players for GT this season.

KKR bowlers ran riot as CSK scored just 103 for 9 in front of their home crowd.

MS Dhoni fails with bat on captaincy return in horror CSK batting showIPL 2025, CSK vs KKR: MS Dhoni, walking at No. 9, managed just 1 run before he was dismissed by Sunil Narine. CSK were restricted to 103 for 9 in 20 overs -- their lowest total at Chepauk in the history of the Indian Premier League.

SRH coach Daniel Vettori backs misfiring batting order to bounce backDaniel Vettori has backed SRH's misfiring batting order to deliver after their poor start to the IPL 2025 campaign. The likes of Travis Head, Abhishek Sharma and Heinrich Klaasen have failed to make a mark this season.

Charles Barkley leaves Michael B. Jordan in splits with hilarious question on NBA on TNTAs part of the promotional tour for his upcoming film Sinners, actor Michael B. Jordan made a guest appearance on NBA on TNT, joining Ernie Johnson, Shaquille O'Neal, Kenny Smith, and Charles Barkley for a lively courtside chat.

NBA Standings 2025: Western conference Playoff race heats up as regular season nears endOnly three days remaining in the 2024-25 NBA regular season, the playoff picture in the Western Conference remains in chaos. Though the Eastern Conference is mostly sorted out, there is a thin margin between postseason spots in the West.

Sir James Anderson: England great awarded knighthood after retirementJames Anderson, 42, became the first England cricketer since Andrew Strauss and Alastair Cook in 2019 to be awarded a Knighthood. Anderson retired from international cricket last year after 704 wickets.

Tom Brady to feature in new Birmingham city documentary coming to Prime videoFormer American footballer Tom Brady is set to appear in a new behind-the-scenes documentary following Birmingham City Football Club, which will stream globally on Prime Video in summer 2025.

No one-size-fits-all approach for LSG batters, says David MillerIPL 2025, LSG vs KKR: Speaking to the press on the eve of their home game against Gujarat Titans, Lucknow Super Giants all-rounder said their batters will look to play according to the situation and conditions despite the frequency of big totals in the season.

CSK vs KKR: Chennai make two key changes in MS Dhoni's return as captainChennai Super Kings have made two key changes to their lineup as MS Dhoni returns as the skipper of the team. Rahul Tripathi and Anshul Kamboj make a return to the team for the clash against KKR.

Watch: MS Dhoni struggles to hide smile as Ravi Shastri calls him 'uncapped'IPL 2025, KKR vs CSK: MS Dhoni was not able to hide his smile as Ravi Shastri referred to him as the 'Thala' of Chennai and went on to quip that the 43-year-old was 'uncapped at the moment'. Dhoni returned to lead CSK for the first time in 683 days on Friday.

Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim defends Andre Onana after Lyon horror showManchester United boss Ruben Amorim has defended Andre Onana after the goalkeeper's poor show against Lyon in the first leg of the quarterfinal of the Europa League. The match between United and Lyon ended in a draw due to Onana's mistakes.

Ashish Nehra a strict tactician? Shahrukh Khan explains GT coach's mantraShahrukh Khan praised GT coach Ashish Nehra and said that the former Indian pacer is an intelligent coach and not an animated one. Nehra has helped GT make a comeback this season in the IPL.

Vipraj Nigam will be household name in Indian cricket: Kevin PietersenIPL 2025: Kevin Pietersen heaped praise on 20-year-old Vipraj Nigam, saying the all-rounder has the ability in him to become a household name in Indian cricket. Vipraj shone in Delhi's win over RCB in Bengaluru on Thursday, picking up two wickets, including that of Virat Kohli.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
